intro: Stachytarpheta bracteosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, which attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its foliage is often covered in a fine, velvety texture, giving it its common name. Stachytarpheta bracteosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats and can be cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
